intro: Linaria bentii, commonly known as the Sierra larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, dry habitats such as slopes and cliffs, thriving in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are bilaterally symmetrical with five petals. Linaria bentii is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its striking appearance.
